_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: All Other Basic Organic Chemical Manufacturing

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Quaker City Chemicals facility located at 7360 Milnor Street, Philadelphia PA provides chemical distribution services for customers throughout the Mid-Atlantic USA.  These services include the storage and transport of hazardous chemicals.  We are proud of our safety record and strive to ensure that we design and operate our facility so that hazards are minimized and risks controlled..

We have one process and one hazardous substance onsite in a quantity that exceeds the threshold quantity designated by EPA under 40CFRpart 68.  That substance (ethylene diamine) is used in our packaged  chemical storage process, which involves the storage of chemicals in 55 gallon drums.  No other processing of this substance occurs at our facility.

Using EPA-approved methods and technology, we have analyzed worst-case and alternative scenarios for the unlikely release of ethylene diamine, from our facility .  The results of these analyses, including any public or environmental receptors are available from the US EPA upon request.  Based on criteria defined by EPA, we have determined that a Risk Management Program Level 1 applies to the stated process.

We have specific programs and practices in place for controlling this process to help ensure that a harmful release of chemicals stored and handled at our facility does not occur.  These programs and practices include:
-    Use of recognized good engineering practices in the design, installation and operation of our equipment and ensuring the equipment meets applicable codes and standards.
-    Continual assessment of hazards and safeguards in our process, in order to reduce risks, by our personnel, our suppliers and recognized chemical experts.
-    Maintaining preparedness and contingency plans for responding to any emergency that may occur and coordinating these plans with local response agencies.
-    Coordination of our Emergency Contingency Plan with local Fire Department and Emergency Response agencies

Quaker City Chemicals is continu

ally seeking ways to improve the safety and environmental performance of our operations.  Consistent with that policy, our facility has been designed to include best practices in safety and environmental protection advancements.  The effectiveness of our chemical management programs and practices has been recognized by the National Association of Chemical Distributors (NACD) through Responsible Distribution Process certification.  We continually monitor our operations to identify ways to maintain a leadership position within our industry in environmental, health and safety practices
